newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt Suez Canal May receipts up, tourism down.
newsitem.headline: Egypt Suez Canal May receipts up, tourism down.

text.p: Egypt's earnings from the Suez Canal in May 1997 rose to $162.2 million from $149.3 million in the previous month, government statistics showed.
The receipts were $157.5 million in May 1996, the Cabinet's Information and Decision Support Centre (IDSC) said in a bulletin made available on Tuesday.
But tourism receipts eased to $285 million in May from $326 million in April, and $268 million in May, 1996, IDSC said.
The decline in tourism earnings in May could be attributed to the start of the low summer season in Egypt.
Tourism and the Suez Canal, together with expatriates' remittances, form the bulk of Egypt's foreign currency income.
